text: kin 90% Hypertelorism 90% Hypoplasia of the zygomatic bone 90% Joint hypermobility 90% Laryngomalacia 90% Macrotia 90% Pectus excavatum 90% Prominent metopic ridge 90% Proptosis 90% Respiratory insufficiency 90% Short nose 90% Strabismus 90% Talipes 90% Umbilical hernia 90% Upslanted palpebral fissure 90% The Human Phenotype Ontology (HPO) has collected information on how often a sign or symptom occurs in a condition. Much of this information comes from Orphanet, a European rare disease database
